Comparing Two Revisions of the Same File

With Visual Diff, you can compare any two revisions of the same text file, including the current (tip) revision, prior revisions, and the file or files in your working folder.

To compare two revisions of the same file:

  1. Select the File tab.

  2. Select the History tab. This action displays the History list.

  3. Select two revisions of a file from the History list.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Compare Contents button on the toolbar.

    • Select Compare Contents from the History context menu.

    Visual Diff displays the two revisions and their differences.

  5. To return to the application, select File > Exit from the Visual Diff menu.

To compare the tip revision of a file to the file in your working folder:

  1. Select the File tab and highlight the name of a file.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Compare Contents button on the toolbar.

    • Select Compare Contents from the File menu or context menu.

    Visual Diff displays the two revisions and their differences.

  3. To return to the application, select File > Exit from the Visual Diff menu.

To compare a prior revision of a file to the file in your working folder (Cross-Platform client only):

  1. Select the File tab, and highlight the name of a file

  2. Select the History tab. This action displays the History list.

  3. Select a prior revision of the file from the History list.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Compare Contents button on the toolbar.

    • Select Compare Contents from the History context menu.

    Visual Diff displays the two revisions and their differences.

  5. To return to the application, select File > Exit from the Visual Diff menu.
